name: Ethiopian Collard Greens (Ye'abesha Gomen)
ingredients: 1½ lbs. collard greens, stemmed and cut crosswise into ¼"-wide strips
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
2 Thai chiles, stemmed, seeded, and minced (optional)
instructions: Destem 1 ½ pounds of collard greens.
Mince 1 large onion and put in a ramekin.
Mince 3 cloves of garlic and put in small ramekin.
Mince the ginger and combine with garlic.
Heat butter in a 4-qt. pot over medium heat.
Add ethiopian spices  and cook, stirring often, until fragrant, 1–2 minutes.
Increase heat to medium-high and add oil; add onions and cook, stirring often, until browned, 10 minutes.
Add garlic, chiles, and ginger and cook, stirring often, until soft and fragrant, 3 minutes.
Add collards, 1⅓ cups water, and salt and pepper; cover and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until collards are tender, 50–55 minutes.
Stir in vinegar and serve collards hot.
